intro: Thesium pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean thesium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Thesium pyrenaicum thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland or alpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of the mountain flora in its native region.
